snippet: The measure hit the highest level since July 2007, rising to 84.9 from 82.6, indicating that Americans had a more optimistic view of the economy.
abstract: Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment indicator shows increasingly upbeat view of the economy and job market drove measure to 84.9 in November from 82.6, its highest level in more than five years.
lead_paragraph: The measure hit the highest level since July 2007, rising to 84.9 from 82.6, indicating that Americans had a more optimistic view of the economy.

headline.main: Consumer Confidence Climbs to a 5-Year High
headline.print_headline: Consumer Confidence Climbs to a 5-Year High
